column8:
It all started on 16th July 1969. Four days and 363,000 km later, the Apollo 11 Command Service Module "Columbia" entered Lunar orbit for the first of thirty revolutions. Shortly afterwards Neil & Buzz descended to the magnificent desolation below to create one of (if not THE) most important and memorable events in the history of mankind.

This design celebrates and admires 1969, the year of our successful Lunar landing. Such an important year, I have used "1969" as the basis of my design with a 60's style drawing of the interior of Columbia CSM from the successful landing mission.  Celebrate vision, extarordinary engineering, courage and daring, wear our 1969 AD t shirt.
column21: This t-shirt design admires the year 1969 and the Apollo Program's Lunar Landing success in particular. The image shows the inside of the command/service module, drawn in comic style.

column8:
In the early 90's my wife bought my eldest daughter a cheap rod and reel from the tackle shop in our local village.  My daughter, otherwise scorned as clearly a newbie by the boys round Stonegate pond in East Sussex promptly pulled a large Bream, the biggest any of the said boys had seen out of said pond at her first attempt.  Four children meant four of everything and I was to pick up the bill.  That week a liquidation auction for a tackle shop in Hastings was announced in the small print of the local press.  My wife obtained the auction catalogue.  The details were Greek to me and we turned to an accomplished angler for advice.  Off my wife went to Hastings, I did not join her, it would have meant a day off.  The advice was Abu Garcia are best.  What to pay?  I said if it is described as being in good condition just put your hand up till you own it.

The scene that was described had the room packed with gruff anglers looking askance at a petite woman dressed for the occasion, that is to say tailored and tasteful.  As my wife set about overfilling her boots, about ten reels and rods and quite a lot else besides,  several of them started to discretely ask her for advice, along the lines of what do you make of this pointing to some catalogue description and one or two grudgingly offered their congratulations as she won yet another bidding set to.

My family's affection for things Abu Garcia and fishing was established.  Please express affection for Abu Garcia by wearing out Abu Toro 50 HS Ambassadeur t shirt.
column21: Abu Garcia Torq 50 HS fishing reel t shirt.

column8:
This t-shirt deign admires the oldest active trophy in international sport, the legendary "America's Cup".

Since 1851, the America's Cup has attracted top sailors and yacht designers from all over the globe.

It is not only a test of sailing skill, boat and sail design, but also of fund-raising and management skills. From the first defense in 1870 the matches were between very large (65 ft (20 m) or greater on the waterline) racing yachts owned by wealthy sportsmen. This culminated in races between magnificent J-class yachts in 1930, 1934 and 1937.

After World War II almost twenty years went by without a challenge, so the New York Yacht Club made changes to the Deed to allow the smaller and less expensive 12 metre class yachts to compete, and this class was used until 1987 when it was replaced by the International America's Cup Class.

My design has a list of all the winners of the America's cup from 1851 to 1995

This t-shirt admires the 1979 Epic, Apocalypse Now.
A fantastic movie, Apocalypse Now has a great cast and features some brilliant directing, especially the most famous scene of the Huey's & Little Birds launching a sunrise attack on the village.
"I love the smell of napalm in the morning" is without a doubt the most repeated line from the movie and would have to be in the running to be one of the most famous lines of all time!
I have used this in my design, along with a later part of the quote that is less repeated, but a vital part of it I think.. "it smells like... (pause) victory."

This quote follows an impressive napalm explosion delivered by four F-5 Tigers... awesome.
column21: Apocalypse Now t shirt. Francis Ford Coppola's Vietnam war epic. Endlessly quotable and watchable with great performances by Martin Sheen and of course Marlon Brando.
